title: Odilon Redon (Art painting Ebook).pdf
description:
Pdf / English / 1971 / 100 Pages / 15 MB

Among all the artists that stud the history of 19th and 20th century painting, the work of Odilon Redon is the most singular and least explored of his time. Painter of a world in which the elements of tangible reality and the phantasms of the  imagination intermingle, he has created a veritable aesthetic of the unfixed boundaries of man's perceptions, and, as such, he stands as a precursor to  Surrealism. He has followed - outside any school and untouched by any influence - a road in which each step reveals his love of nature and his need for dream ; a road which Ã¢â‚¬â€ through the detour of a private and mysterious mythology Ã¢â‚¬â€ reaches its culmination in an evocation of the marvelous.
